intro: Lachenalia fistulosa, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Lachenalia fistulosa is known for its resilience and ability to store water in its leaves, adapting to arid environments.
